reviews.review_text:
We stopped at Route 66 for a very late lunch after looking up the restaurant on Google. Since it was an odd hour it was sparse with just one other group. I was quite impressed by the striking interiors and artwork to reflect the pan-American cuisine. The space is open and inviting with the dining furniture comprising solid tables and chairs as well as diner style booths.
The staff was courteous and accommodating. We had dietary restrictions and the chef was able to conform to our requests. The food quality and taste was not compromised. Our custom order thin crust vegan pizza was a winner!
The cocktails are amazing.
A special shout out to Chetana for ensuring our experience was enjoyable!

Theme and ambience were good but the seats seamed like they weren't cleaned in a long time and had dust all over it.
They have very limited options for chicken lovers but they do give an option of replacing the patty with a chicken one, so that's good. We ordered the Route 66 burger and Veg primavera pizza - both of which were amazing. Price was on the higher side though.
The cocktails were poorly made with bad taste. Not worth the price at all.
Won't recommend this place for drinks but only for the food.

Went to Route 66 after a spade of years. They used to be known for their hamburgers and steaks. The decor is bit confusing between a pop-rock and Texan style and bit dated looking. However the 90s music was really nice. The hamburgers luckily were still the old style way and they had not lost their touch here. Served typically with a knife to cut the hamburger. Had the chicken roxette, pork fat boy and beef route 66 special served with old style coke bottles.
